title.textElement: Harvard Law School faculty tenure photograph collection

group.notes: General: Beginning in 1976 and continuing to the present, official portraits are taken when faculty members received tenure. Prior to 2012, prints of these photographs hung on the walls of Pound Hall, as of 2020 they hang on the walls of the Wasserstein Hall, Caspersen Student Center, Clinical Wing complex (WCC).

Citation/references: Detail published in: Harvard Law School Bulletin. Cambridge, Mass. : The School, v. 14, no. 6 (June 1963): 4.
Historical: The photograph was taken on the occasion of Professor Glueck delivering an address to alumni of the Law School and Graduate School of Arts and Sciences at their joint luncheon.

Subject: 1920 earned an A.B. from George Washington University, and a LL.B and LL.M. from National University Law School. 1924 earned a Ph.D. from the Harvard Department of Social Ethics. 1925-29, Instructor, Department of Social Ethics, Harvard University; 1929-32, Assistant Professor of Criminology, Harvard Law School (HLS); 1932-50, Professor of Criminology, HLS; 1950-63, the first Roscoe Pound Professor of Law, HLS; 1963-80, Roscoe Pound Professor of Law, Emeritus.
